content.text: BUENOS AIRES ( Reuters ) - Argentine President Mauricio Macri said on Friday he will increase subsidies for poor families with children by 46 percent , as the centre-right leader prepares to run for a second term in October . In his annual State of the Union address to Congress , Macri vowed to continue his programme of investment-friendly reforms despite being jeered by opposition lawmakers who favour a bigger government role in Latin America 's third largest economy .
